column2: Initial needs assessments completed and disseminated within 72 hours​ of the event.
column3: Disaster Brief done to inform the FAD between 48-72 h
column4: EA is launched within 24 hours after the FAD has been approved (or within 48 hours after field report was published).
column5: Operational Strategy validated 7 days after the EA
column6: A resource mobilization plan is developed and approved within 2 weeks of the EA
column7: IFRC having the green light from the receiving NS to deploy RR 24h after the disaster
column8: RR personnel Alert sent within 12h of the request
column9: Identification of 1st rotation RR personnel within 48h of the alert
column10: Key initial longer-term positions identified by operational leadership and requested via submission in the HR system, one week after the EA publication
column11: Once approved in the HR system and pre-classified JD provided, HR advertises key initial longer-term positions within 48 hours.
column12: Hold a mini summit within 48 h of the disaster
column13: review/adapt membership coordination for the context for this specific emergency
column14: Appropriate membership coordination is in place after 24h of disaster
column15: Supply chain plan developed between logs and ops coordinator within 1 week of the approved EA
column17: If the country is not MSR, enough resource (HR/Funds) have been allocated to operate in a Red/orange security phase areas
